alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Piscataquis County through 615 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Rockwood to 14 miles west of Greenville to 14 miles northwest of Blanchard. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Kokadjo, Lobster Lake, Rockwood, White Cap Mountain, Lobster Township, Frenchtown, Northeast Carry, Elliottsville, Shirley, Beaver Cove, Spencer Bay, Lily Bay and Mount Kineo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for north central and west central Maine.
